definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to eat depending on the dish (idiom); fig. to act according to actual circumstances/to live within one's means
"meals prepared at separate stoves", slogan of the program of fiscal decentralization that began in the 1980s in the PRC
eating comes first, then comes everything else (idiom) (Tw)
eat depending on the dish, cut cloth according to the body (idiom); to fit the appetite to the dishes and the dress to the figure/to act according to actual circumstances/to live within one's means
pinyin: kan1 cai4 chi1 fan4 , liang2 ti3 cai2 yi1

sentences.english: I was having lunch with Galt at a French restaurant near her apartment in Chelsea.
sentences.chinese: 我们在高特切尔西区公寓附近的法国餐馆吃饭。

sentences.english: Hemingway enjoyed his lunches at the Course Restaurant, which is still functioning.
sentences.chinese: 海明威喜欢在赛场的餐厅吃饭，这家餐厅仍然在营业。

sentences.english: He frequently to Wang Jing wage restaurant meals, and when the waiter asked her designated.
sentences.chinese: 他频繁来王静打工的餐馆吃饭，并指定要她当服务员。

sentences.english: I feel too tired to go out for dinner . Let's eat in again tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我累得没力气出去吃饭，今天晚上我们还是在家吃吧。

sentences.english: Students eat huddled around makeshift coal burners for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 学生们围在煤炉旁边吃饭边取暖。

sentences.english: You can also check your blood glucose before you eat a snack or meal.
sentences.chinese: 当然在加餐或吃饭之前，你也可以检测你的血糖水平。

sentences.english: Tyler never ate in restaurants, and Marla wasn't wrinkled.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒从来不在餐馆里吃饭，而马拉也没有长皱纹。

sentences.english: Then it flew to the butter-cask and down into the meal-tub and out again.
sentences.chinese: 然后，它飞到了酥油桶又下到吃饭浴缸和出来。

sentences.english: She and her husband, Steve, ate meals with us.
sentences.chinese: 她和她的丈夫，史蒂夫和我们一起吃饭。

sentences.english: Before each meal my father or mother would say a prayer of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭前父亲或母亲总要作谢饭祷告。

sentences.english: When I dine in a restaurant, I love a tcapable to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我上饭馆吃饭时喜爱一独立个体占一张桌。

sentences.english: Smaller bites also help your body realize when it’s full.
sentences.chinese: 小口吃饭也容易让你的身体认识到自己吃饱了。

sentences.english: Let me take you to dinner and we can talk thigns over.
sentences.chinese: 走，我请你吃饭，然后慢慢给你解释。

sentences.english: Romance is every time I eat a bowl of left Douer you will help me to pass out.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是我每次吃饭留下的碗兜儿你都会帮我打发掉。

sentences.english: Today I finished watching the whole set of the teleplay named “Living in Small” at noon.
sentences.chinese: 今天中午吃饭时把《蜗居》看完了。

sentences.english: Our dinner lasted as long as four hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃饭吃了四个小时。

definition: to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
